metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4557 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Security Screen (_core_/securite/ecran_securite.php) before 1.1.8 for SPIP, as used in SPIP 3.0.x before 3.0.12, allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP via the connect parameter.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4557` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

spip - 3.0.14-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spip package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.14-1').
